result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:35 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney John P Bjork in court for Rodney Allen Sorrow, Defendant Rodney Allen Sorrow in court, in custody. Court reviews file, Atty. Bjork appointed today. Atty. Bjork states that DE may have funds to post bond, will try to help DE makes arrangements to get that money. Court notes previously scheduled hearings. Adjourned: 1:37 PM. kma

10:31 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rodney Allen Sorrow in court, in custody. DE did not qualify for public defender and PFAC not filed. DE states that he completed the form but left it in his jail cell. Court resets STC for this afternoon, deputy will bring PFAC up before hearing. Adjourned: 10:36 AM. kma

Criminal Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 10/6/22. ec: Attys. kma

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Christine I.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

DE does not qualify for public defender, PFAC provided. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. Bond arguments. Court sets STC for attorney status, SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:34 PM. kma
